title: Cats won’t risk Martin
text:
Perth Wildcats ultra-cautious with Damian Martin’s return from calf injury Chris Robinson PerthNow Perth Wildcats ultra-cautious with Damian Martin’s return from calf injury Chris Robinson PerthNow Casey Prather and Damian Martin (centre) both missed Perth’s game on Friday night. 
ONCE bitten, twice shy. 
That’s the approach Perth will continue to take with Damian Martin as it resists rushing back the injured skipper despite a mounting injury toll ahead of Sunday’s road assignment in Illawarra. 
Martin missed Australia’s Olympic qualifying series in August with a calf tear before re-aggravating the injury in a pre-season return last month. 
The five-time Defensive Player of the Year said he was unlikely to suit up against the Hawks despite pushing hard for a recall at training this week. 
“It’s been tough – especially now that I’m on the (practice) court,” Martin told The Sunday Times . 
“I did 80 per cent of training on Monday, about the same on Tuesday, and then the whole session on Thursday. Other Stories
